name: Long-term changes in regional security and military activity in Finnish border area

children.name: Finland closed its border with Russia in late 2023
children.description: Reuters reported that Finland closed its border with Russia in late 2023 after accusing Russia of sending migrants to the frontier.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates tightened border governance and movement restrictions on Finland’s eastern border (Finland closed its border with Russia in late 2023).

children.name: border crossing points on Finland’s eastern border are closed
children.description: The Finnish Border Guard states that border crossing points on Finland’s eastern border are closed to traffic until further notice.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates tightened border governance and movement restrictions on Finland’s eastern border (border crossing points on Finland’s eastern border are closed).

children.name: cross-border trade and tourism collapse has cost Finland’s border regions
children.description: Reuters reported that cross-border trade and tourism collapse has cost Finland’s border regions over €300 million annually.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates tightened border governance and movement restrictions on Finland’s eastern border (cross-border trade and tourism collapse has cost Finland’s border regions).

children.name: The Finnish Border Guard lists railway traffic through Vainikkala
children.description: The Finnish Border Guard lists railway traffic through Vainikkala as an exception for commercial traffic while the eastern border crossing points are otherwise closed.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates tightened border governance and movement restrictions on Finland’s eastern border (The Finnish Border Guard lists railway traffic through Vainikkala).

children.name: cargo vessel traffic may be received at the port
children.description: The Finnish Border Guard states that cargo vessel traffic may be received at the port of Nuijamaa where necessary.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates tightened border governance and movement restrictions on Finland’s eastern border (cargo vessel traffic may be received at the port).

children.name: the maritime border crossing points for leisure boating at Haapasaari
children.description: The Finnish Border Guard states that the maritime border crossing points for leisure boating at Haapasaari and Santio are closed until further notice.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates tightened border governance and movement restrictions on Finland’s eastern border (the maritime border crossing points for leisure boating at Haapasaari).

children.name: Border Security Act and asylum rules
the President of the Republic approved the Border Security Act
children.description: The Ministry of the Interior states that the President of the Republic approved the Border Security Act on 16 July 2024 and that it entered into force on 22 July 2024.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates tightened border governance and movement restrictions on Finland’s eastern border (the President of the Republic approved the Border Security Act).

children.name: an amendment confirmed on 27 June 2025 extended the Border
children.description: The Ministry of the Interior states that an amendment confirmed on 27 June 2025 extended the Border Security Act until 31 December 2026 and entered into force on 1 July 2025.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates tightened border governance and movement restrictions on Finland’s eastern border (an amendment confirmed on 27 June 2025 extended the Border).

children.name: amendments on the use of technology in maintaining border security
children.description: The Ministry of the Interior states that amendments on the use of technology in maintaining border security were approved on 28 June 2024 and entered into force on 5 July 2024.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates tightened border governance and movement restrictions on Finland’s eastern border (amendments on the use of technology in maintaining border security).

children.name: Finland is building a fence on the eastern border
children.description: The Ministry of the Interior states that Finland is building a fence on the eastern border to improve border control and support management of incidents at the border.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates strengthening of border infrastructure, surveillance, or enforcement capabilities (Finland is building a fence on the eastern border).

children.name: a 200-kilometre high-tech border fence is under construction along Finland’s
children.description: Reuters reported that a 200-kilometre high-tech border fence is under construction along Finland’s border with Russia.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates strengthening of border infrastructure, surveillance, or enforcement capabilities (a 200-kilometre high-tech border fence is under construction along Finland’s).

children.name: the eastern border fence will reduce Finland’s dependence on the
children.description: The Ministry of the Interior states that the eastern border fence will reduce Finland’s dependence on the effectiveness of Russian border control.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates strengthening of border infrastructure, surveillance, or enforcement capabilities (the eastern border fence will reduce Finland’s dependence on the).

children.name: a legislative amendment entering into force on 5 July 2024
children.description: The Ministry of the Interior states that a legislative amendment entering into force on 5 July 2024 expanded the Border Guard’s technical surveillance and granted new powers for radio-technology-based surveillance.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates strengthening of border infrastructure, surveillance, or enforcement capabilities (a legislative amendment entering into force on 5 July 2024).

children.name: acts securing the Border Guard’s human resources were adopted
children.description: The Ministry of the Interior states that acts securing the Border Guard’s human resources were adopted on 17 May 2024 and entered into force on 15 June 2024.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates strengthening of border infrastructure, surveillance, or enforcement capabilities (acts securing the Border Guard’s human resources were adopted).

children.name: amendments to improve conditions for combating offences investigated by the
children.description: The Ministry of the Interior states that amendments to improve conditions for combating offences investigated by the Border Guard were approved on 27 June 2025 and entered into force on 1 September 2025.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates strengthening of border infrastructure, surveillance, or enforcement capabilities (amendments to improve conditions for combating offences investigated by the).

children.name: comments on strengthening the Border Guard’s preparedness-related powers ran
children.description: The Ministry of the Interior states that comments on strengthening the Border Guard’s preparedness-related powers ran from 9 December 2025 to 21 January 2026.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates strengthening of border infrastructure, surveillance, or enforcement capabilities (comments on strengthening the Border Guard’s preparedness-related powers ran).

children.name: The Ministry of the Interior lists a government Report
children.description: The Ministry of the Interior lists a government Report on Internal Security submitted to Parliament on 11 September 2025.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates strengthening of border infrastructure, surveillance, or enforcement capabilities (The Ministry of the Interior lists a government Report).

children.name: a legislative project on the Finnish Border Guard’s criminal intelligence
children.description: The Ministry of the Interior states that a legislative project on the Finnish Border Guard’s criminal intelligence activities runs from 24 November 2025 to 30 October 2026.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates strengthening of border infrastructure, surveillance, or enforcement capabilities (a legislative project on the Finnish Border Guard’s criminal intelligence).

children.name: Finnish Defence Forces posture near the border
the Jaeger Brigade’s readiness unit exercise RYSKE would be held
children.description: The Finnish Army stated that the Jaeger Brigade’s readiness unit exercise RYSKE would be held in Ivalo and the Tsarmitunturi fell area on 4–11 February 2026.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates increased Finnish Defence Forces readiness, training, or capability development near the border (the Jaeger Brigade’s readiness unit exercise RYSKE would be held).

children.name: Utti Jaeger Regiment would train in Northern Finland from 2
children.description: The Finnish Army stated that Utti Jaeger Regiment would train in Northern Finland from 2 February to 27 March 2026 with about 1,000 soldiers including allied-country participants.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates increased Finnish Defence Forces readiness, training, or capability development near the border (Utti Jaeger Regiment would train in Northern Finland from 2).

children.name: it would exercise local defence during 20 February 6 March
children.description: The Finnish Army stated that it would exercise local defence during 20 February–6 March 2026 with up to about 3,500 soldiers and other authorities.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates increased Finnish Defence Forces readiness, training, or capability development near the border (it would exercise local defence during 20 February 6 March).

children.name: production of Finland’s first F-35A fighters began in the latter
children.description: The Finnish Air Force stated that production of Finland’s first F-35A fighters began in the latter part of 2023.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates increased Finnish Defence Forces readiness, training, or capability development near the border (production of Finland’s first F-35A fighters began in the latter).

children.name: Finland has contracted the manufacturing lots 17 22 for its
children.description: The Finnish Air Force stated that Finland has contracted the manufacturing lots 17–22 for its F-35A fighters.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates increased Finnish Defence Forces readiness, training, or capability development near the border (Finland has contracted the manufacturing lots 17 22 for its).

children.name: Patria to conduct final assembly of the first F135 fighter
children.description: Patria and Pratt & Whitney signed an agreement for Patria to conduct final assembly of the first F135 fighter jet engines for Finland and stated that production had already begun.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates increased Finnish Defence Forces readiness, training, or capability development near the border (Patria to conduct final assembly of the first F135 fighter).

children.name: Finland raised its reservist age limit to 65
children.description: Reuters reported that Finland raised its reservist age limit to 65.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates increased Finnish Defence Forces readiness, training, or capability development near the border (Finland raised its reservist age limit to 65).

children.name: Finland was stockpiling landmines
children.description: Reuters reported that Finland was stockpiling landmines.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates increased Finnish Defence Forces readiness, training, or capability development near the border (Finland was stockpiling landmines).

children.name: Finland was building a NATO Northern Command in Mikkeli
children.description: Reuters reported that Finland was building a NATO Northern Command in Mikkeli.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates increased Finnish Defence Forces readiness, training, or capability development near the border (Finland was building a NATO Northern Command in Mikkeli).

children.name: Finland decided in August 2022 to start negotiations with the
children.description: Finland’s Ministry of Defence states that Finland decided in August 2022 to start negotiations with the United States on a Defence Cooperation Agreement.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates deepening international defence cooperation and NATO-related activity affecting Finland and the region (Finland decided in August 2022 to start negotiations with the).

children.name: a draft government proposal on the DCA was sent out
children.description: The Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland stated that a draft government proposal on the DCA was sent out for comments on 28 March 2024.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates deepening international defence cooperation and NATO-related activity affecting Finland and the region (a draft government proposal on the DCA was sent out).

children.name: the Finnish Parliament approved the Defence Cooperation Agreement with the
children.description: Yle reported that the Finnish Parliament approved the Defence Cooperation Agreement with the United States on 1 July 2024.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates deepening international defence cooperation and NATO-related activity affecting Finland and the region (the Finnish Parliament approved the Defence Cooperation Agreement with the).

children.name: the DCA entered into force on 1 September 2024
children.description: Finland’s Ministry of Defence states that the DCA entered into force on 1 September 2024.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates deepening international defence cooperation and NATO-related activity affecting Finland and the region (the DCA entered into force on 1 September 2024).

children.name: an Implementing Agreement Regarding Infrastructure under the DCA was signed
children.description: Finland’s Ministry of Defence states that an Implementing Agreement Regarding Infrastructure under the DCA was signed on 13 August 2025.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates deepening international defence cooperation and NATO-related activity affecting Finland and the region (an Implementing Agreement Regarding Infrastructure under the DCA was signed).

children.name: Multinational exercises in the Nordic region
Exercise Steadfast Defender 2024 began on 24 January 2024
children.description: SHAPE stated that Exercise Steadfast Defender 2024 began on 24 January 2024.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates deepening international defence cooperation and NATO-related activity affecting Finland and the region (Exercise Steadfast Defender 2024 began on 24 January 2024).

children.name: Test-1
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates deepening international defence cooperation and NATO-related activity affecting Finland and the region (Test-1).

children.name: the main battles of Exercise Nordic Response 24 began
children.description: The Finnish Defence Forces stated that the main battles of Exercise Nordic Response 24 began on 7 March 2024.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates deepening international defence cooperation and NATO-related activity affecting Finland and the region (the main battles of Exercise Nordic Response 24 began).

children.name: The Norwegian Armed Forces state that the main part
children.description: The Norwegian Armed Forces state that the main part of Nordic Response exercise activities took place in the northern Nordic region from 3 to 14 March 2024.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates deepening international defence cooperation and NATO-related activity affecting Finland and the region (The Norwegian Armed Forces state that the main part).

children.name: Arctic Challenge Exercise 2023 would take place from 29 May
children.description: NATO Allied Command stated that Arctic Challenge Exercise 2023 would take place from 29 May to 9 June 2023.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates deepening international defence cooperation and NATO-related activity affecting Finland and the region (Arctic Challenge Exercise 2023 would take place from 29 May).

children.name: NATO integration steps affecting the border area
Finland joined NATO on 4 April 2023
children.description: Reuters reported that Finland joined NATO on 4 April 2023.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates deepening international defence cooperation and NATO-related activity affecting Finland and the region (Finland joined NATO on 4 April 2023).

children.name: Nordic Response 2024 is a Norway-led military exercise held across
children.description: The Associated Press reported that Nordic Response 2024 is a Norway-led military exercise held across Finland, Norway and Sweden.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates deepening international defence cooperation and NATO-related activity affecting Finland and the region (Nordic Response 2024 is a Norway-led military exercise held across).

children.name: Finland shares a 1 340-kilometre border with Russia
children.description: Reuters reported that Finland shares a 1,340-kilometre border with Russia.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates deepening international defence cooperation and NATO-related activity affecting Finland and the region (Finland shares a 1 340-kilometre border with Russia).

children.name: Russian military changes and activity relevant to the Finnish border
TASS reported on 21 December 2022 that Defence Minister Sergei
children.description: TASS reported on 21 December 2022 that Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu proposed re-establishing the Moscow and Leningrad Military Districts.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates Russian military organisational or activity changes relevant to the Finnish border area (TASS reported on 21 December 2022 that Defence Minister Sergei).

children.name: Sergei Shoigu said an army corps would be formed
children.description: The Barents Observer reported that Sergei Shoigu said an army corps would be formed in Karelia.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates Russian military organisational or activity changes relevant to the Finnish border area (Sergei Shoigu said an army corps would be formed).

children.name: Vladimir Putin signed a decree on 26 February 2024 reestablishing
children.description: The Barents Observer reported that Vladimir Putin signed a decree on 26 February 2024 reestablishing the Moscow and Leningrad military districts with changes valid from 1 March 2024.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates Russian military organisational or activity changes relevant to the Finnish border area (Vladimir Putin signed a decree on 26 February 2024 reestablishing).

children.name: Base and troop indicators near the Finnish border
Yle reported on 11 January 2025 that satellite images showed
children.description: Yle reported on 11 January 2025 that satellite images showed Russian troops stationed near the Finnish border were focusing on the war in Ukraine.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates Russian military organisational or activity changes relevant to the Finnish border area (Yle reported on 11 January 2025 that satellite images showed).

children.name: Yle reported on 17 June 2025 that satellite images showed
children.description: Yle reported on 17 June 2025 that satellite images showed extensive construction work at the Lupche-Savino garrison near Kandalaksha across the border from Finnish Lapland.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates Russian military organisational or activity changes relevant to the Finnish border area (Yle reported on 17 June 2025 that satellite images showed).

children.name: Yle reported on 20 May 2025 that the New York
children.description: Yle reported on 20 May 2025 that the New York Times said Russia was building up a base along the Finnish border based on satellite imagery.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates Russian military organisational or activity changes relevant to the Finnish border area (Yle reported on 20 May 2025 that the New York).

children.name: Yle reported on 30 January 2026 that Russia was upgrading
children.description: Yle reported on 30 January 2026 that Russia was upgrading a Soviet-era garrison in Petrozavodsk.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates Russian military organisational or activity changes relevant to the Finnish border area (Yle reported on 30 January 2026 that Russia was upgrading).

children.name: Official response signals and airspace incidents
two Russian MiG-31 fighter aircraft were suspected of violating Finland’s
children.description: Finland’s Ministry of Defence stated that two Russian MiG-31 fighter aircraft were suspected of violating Finland’s airspace near Porvoo on 18 August 2022.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates Russian military organisational or activity changes relevant to the Finnish border area (two Russian MiG-31 fighter aircraft were suspected of violating Finland’s).

children.name: Finland suspected four Russian military aircraft violated Finnish airspace
children.description: Reuters reported that Finland suspected four Russian military aircraft violated Finnish airspace on 10 June 2024 near Loviisa.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates Russian military organisational or activity changes relevant to the Finnish border area (Finland suspected four Russian military aircraft violated Finnish airspace).

children.name: Finland’s Defence Minister Antti H kk nen said on 18
children.description: Yle reported that Finland’s Defence Minister Antti Häkkänen said on 18 June 2025 that there was "nothing surprising or dramatic" in Russia’s base buildup near the Finnish border.
children.analysis_description: This evidence indicates Russian military organisational or activity changes relevant to the Finnish border area (Finland’s Defence Minister Antti H kk nen said on 18).
